channel.title: Sweets on Family Recipes
channel.description: Recent content in Sweets on Family Recipes

item.title: No-Bake Peanut Butter Bars
item.description: Ingredients 1/2 cup (115g) salted butter, melted 1 cup (120g) graham cracker crumbs (about 8 full sheet graham crackers) 2 cups (240g) confectioners’ sugar 1 cup + 2 Tablespoons (280g) creamy peanut butter, divided 1 cup (180g) semi-sweet chocolate chips Recipe Line an 8×8 or 9×9 inch square baking pan with aluminum foil or parchment paper. Set aside. Mix the melted butter, graham cracker crumbs, and confectioners’ sugar together in a medium bowl.

item.title: Christmas Cardamom Cake
item.description: Ingredients Cake 1 lb. butter or margarine 2 cups light brown sugar 4 eggs 2 tsp vanilla 4 cups flour 2 tsp baking powder 2 ½ tsp baking soda ½ tsp salt 1 tbsp cardamom 2 cups sour cream Filling ¼ cup brown sugar 1 tbsp cinnamon ½ cup finely chopped pecans Recipe Preheat oven to 350. Oil bundt pan. Beat butter with sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time, beat well after each.

item.title: Bunuelos
item.description: Ingredients Dough 3 cups of flour 1 tsp of salt Water Tomatillo leaves Syrup Piloncillo Cinnamon sticks Orange peels Recipe For dough, boil water with tomatillo husks for 15-20 minutes. Strain the husks out and let cool. Add water slowly to dry ingredients as needed. Roll dough into approximately a dozen balls. Let rest for 30 minutes. In a castiron skillet add water, cinnamon sticks, orange peels, and piloncillo. Simmer until piloncillo disolves.
